adrFormatAddress: 610 W 58th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: This review is specifically for HSS Westside physical therapy. I’ve had two terrible experiences with PT’s at HSS. I think they’re overworked & not genuinely interested in the patients recovery. I had Snay at this facility & the first day I met him, the whole evaluation after my 1st surgery, he was lecturing me about how he doesn’t want to hear if I Google symptoms & how he’s annoyed with patients who do that. The 2nd time I saw him, I was in pain, he asked me how I was doing and I was honest with him. He said I don’t want to hear it. I want you to tell me you’re “chugging along.” I couldn’t believe it. I wasn’t getting better because I had an undiagnosed Labral tear that my surgeon did not recognize. So, I’d do the exercises & feel more pain. I also have hypermobile EDS which he didn’t seem to take into account. One day, I expressed my concerns & he said to me “are you talking to someone?” Implying that I need to talk to a therapist. He then said, “because you talk a lot.” I simply ask questions regarding the exercises I’m doing & obviously if I still have pain, I’m going to be concerned & express that. I’ve found that male doctors/therapists in particular do not know how to speak or treat a young woman. I was genuinely offended by his comment as someone who was in pain for a long time, he just made me feel worse or like I was exaggerating my symptoms. I left to go get treated by a facility that spends time with their patients.

originalText.text:
This review is specifically for the PT wing on the bottom floor:

1) everyone gets access to a Delfi BFR machine
2) they accept a wide variety of in-network insurance
3) Olivia is the best PT ever

I saw 7 different PTs and this was the most modern facility I’ve seen to date. Wall to wall gadgets.

originalText.text: Dr. McElheny is possibly the nicest doctor I’ve ever had and so professional. All of the staff in general are great, but Dr. M is above and beyond as a provider!

text.text: Dr. McElheny is possibly the nicest doctor I’ve ever had and so professional. All of the staff in general are great, but Dr. M is above and beyond as a provider!

originalText.text: Top HSS orthopedic surgeons, immaculate new offices and spacious PT/rehab center with the best new top of the line equipment - plus a convenient west side location. What’s not to like?  Surgeon offices are right upstairs from PT - my surgeon came down yesterday while I was in PT to check my recovery and progress. Physical therapists are incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, accessible, etc.  This is where top athletes go to get repaired by the best surgeons in the game, recover and get back on the field!  I couldn’t be happier with this new setup and would recommend the surgeons, PT staff and entire facility to anyone. HSS is perennially ranked #1 in ortho for a reason - this is just another reason why.

originalText.text: Did rehab for partially torn meniscus. Best decision .I made finish my therapy in LATE May. CONTINUE My therapy at home.The knee is feeling normal.My Theripst first name was Astri hope I spelled it right.She was awesome and worked with me at my pace.
